items.title: Why Internal Representations and Their Temporal Dependence Matter for Emotion Inference
items.author: Srishti Goel, Maria GendronDepartment of Psychology, 5755Yale University, New Haven, USA
items.content: <article>Emotion Review, Ahead of Print. Inferences about others’ emotions have largely examined judgments from static presentation of cues (e.g., facial “expressions”), ignoring temporally dynamic and integrative aspects. Here, we extend insights from predictive processing accounts, focusing on ...</article>
